name: hesperetine
Reason: 1,1'-Terphenyl has a melting point of 205 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison can be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The compound hesperetine has two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would significantly augment the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100 degrees Celsius due to the presence of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would significantly augment the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. Additionally, hesperetine has a methoxy group, which can raise the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius due to additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding.
